data.message: Welcome to your 11-day adventure in Japan! This itinerary is designed for couples who want to explore food, culture, all while balancing activities with relaxation. From iconic landmarks to hidden gems, every day brings new highlights. Let's dive in! üå∏

viatorEnhancements.title: Private Walking Tour of Tokyo with a water bus ride. Rate for groups
viatorEnhancements.description:
This tour is a private walking¬†tour for 5 hours. You can enjoy it only in guides with you.

Start your day, the walk of the Japanese style garden Hamarikyu. At the place, you can enjoy powdered green tea "Matcha" and Japanese sweets "Wagashi".

 Move to Asakusa on a water bus from Hamarikyu. The scenery to see from the water bus is a superb view.

Finish the day by uncovering the¬†beautiful historical sights of the ancient Asakusa area and Tokyo‚Äôs oldest Buddhist site, Asakusa Kannon Temple (Senso-ji). You‚Äôll also get to do some shopping in Tokyo Nakamisestreet,

Way of around 250m to continue from Kaminari-mon Gate to Hozo-mon Gate of Senso-ji Temple. They have ‚ÄúSensu‚Äù,‚ÄùKaminari-Okoshi‚Äù,Japanese style dolls and more. These are good for souvenir to your family and friends.

Also, you con enjoy Japanese traditional meal.(like Sushi,Soba,Templa).Meals are not included.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Enjoy an exclusive private experience at House & Garden by Ryue Nishizawa

viatorEnhancements.title: Private Walking Tour of Tokyo with a water bus ride
viatorEnhancements.description:
This is a private sightseeing tour of Tokyo highlights by public transportation. You can enjoy it only in guides with you.

Visit Tokyo‚Äôs important places Including Tsukiji outer market, HamaRikyu, Asakusa Senso-ji Temple, Tokyo Skytree. You can also enjoy a water bus ride from HamaRikyu to Asakusa.

Tsukiji Outer Market, try some fresh seafood and casual Japanese foods. 

The walk of the Japanese style garden Hamarikyu.

Move to Asakusa from Hamarikyu by water bus. The scenery to see from the water bus is a superb view.

Stroll the beautiful historical sights of the ancient Asakusa area and Tokyo‚Äôs oldest Buddhist site, Senso-ji Temple.

Get to do some shopping in Tokyo Nakamisestreet. It‚Äôs way of around 250m to continue from Kaminari-mon Gate to Hozo-mon Gate of Senso-ji Temple.

Visit Ameyoko Shopping Street.

Enjoy the View of Tokyo from Tokyo Skytree which has taken the title of Japan‚Äôs tallest building.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Enjoy an exclusive private experience at House & Garden by Ryue Nishizawa

generalTips: Get a JR Pass for the Shinkansen and JR trains - saves money on Tokyo-Kyoto-Osaka route
Get a Suica or ICOCA card for easy transit payments
Download Google Maps offline for each city
Most shops accept credit cards, but keep ¬•10,000-20,000 cash for small vendors
Temple visits are best in early morning to avoid crowds
Many restaurants are cash-only, especially traditional ones
Convenience stores (7-Eleven, Lawson, FamilyMart) have great food and ATMs
Shoes off before entering traditional spaces - wear easy slip-on shoes
Trash cans are rare - carry a small bag for your waste
Tipping is not customary and can be considered rude
